result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A Baun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed if all financial obligations are paid within 60 days. Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

defendant.name: Baun, Patrick A

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Patrick A Baun in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Patrick A Baun in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Amended Information.  Defense waives reading of Amended Information. Court reviews max. penalties, elements.  Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Defendant agrees with repeater status. Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing.  State advises that Defendant wants additional time to make some payments.  Defense requests 60 days.  Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Patrick A Baun in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Decision, questions whether Information has been prepared.  Defense waives reading of Information. Defense questions third charge, questions whether there's any information to support that charge, requests information from State that supports additional charge. Court questions how Defense wants to proceed.  Defense thinks he has to get a transcript, enters not guilty pleas to Counts 1, 2.  Court will reserve Defendant's right to look into Count 3.  Defense will speak with DA about attempt at resolution.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Motion to dismiss is denied, Defendant bound over for trial
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases

Appearances remain the same.  Testimony taken.  Exhibit 1 - Copy of officer's report.  Exhibit 2 - Certified JOC from case no. 10-CM-22.  Both exhibits offered and received.  Court will take matter under advisement.

Defendant Patrick A Baun in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense presents argument for dismissal of defective complaint.  State presents argument.  Court denies motion. Defense advises of caselaw on point, presents case to State, Court.  Court will take matter under advisement.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.

No contact direct or indirect with JD except incidental contact at Hatco.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Defendant Patrick A Baun in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defense requests prelim within time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
